# Copilot Instructions

## Coding Standards
- Use UTF-8 encoding for all files.
- Make code under Yii2 framework conventions.
- Follow PSR-12 coding standards for PHP.
- Use meaningful variable and function names.
- Write modular and reusable code.
- Include comments and documentation for complex logic.
- Always comment in english.

## Commit Message Guidelines
- Use the imperative mood in the subject line (e.g., "Add feature" instead of "Added feature").
- Keep the subject line under 50 characters.
- Provide a detailed description in the body, explaining the what and why of the changes.
- Use conventional commit prefixes (e.g., feat:, fix:, docs:, style:, refactor:, test:, chore:).

## Testing Requirements
- Write unit tests for all new features and bug fixes.
- Ensure tests cover edge cases and potential failure points.
- Use a consistent testing framework (e.g., PHPUnit for PHP).
- Include instructions for running tests in the project README.
